channel.title: Trophy Dark incursion selection
channel.description: I'm going to be running Trophy Dark soon for a group of friends but I am not familiar with any of the incursions and there are so many. Are there any that folks recommend where I know what content is in there so I can avoid lines for my players? If there is an existing list that would be great too.

item.title: Trophy Dark incursion selection
item.dc:creator: @Christopher_Gmelch
item.description:
@Christopher_Gmelch wrote:

Devil Aim for Me is rock solid. I ran it twice, both times were amazing sessions.
There’s an actual play on Jason Cordova’s YT which could be exelent prep.

Read full topic

item.title: Trophy Dark incursion selection
item.dc:creator: @middlecyclone
item.description:
@middlecyclone wrote:

You just reminded me that I also have that from the Racial Justice bundle! Thank you. I’m probably going to run the weird west one that Michael van Vleet wrote.

Read full topic

item.title: Trophy Dark incursion selection
item.dc:creator: @HeyItsGilbert
item.description:
@HeyItsGilbert wrote:

I ran “A Warm and Pleasant Hum” since I had a copy from an itch bundle. It got my players hooked. I immediately pre-ordered the game on backer kit. Incursions tend to be pretty short and I think as long as you keep the theme in mind, you should probably be ok. I’m certain there are some live plays on YouTube and I believe it was discussed on Fear of a Black Dragon.

Read full topic

item.title: Trophy Dark incursion selection
item.dc:creator: @middlecyclone
item.description:
@middlecyclone wrote:

This is very neat! I appreciate your reply. I listened to some of Flocculent Cathedral from the podcast actual play. I’m unsure which I will run but I’m very into the system.

Read full topic

item.title: Trophy Dark incursion selection
item.dc:creator: @edige23
item.description:
@edige23 wrote:

https://www.gauntlet-rpg.com/codex-index.html has the issues and you can see what Incursions came out in what issues (of course there’s a ton more out there). I dug the The Flocculent Cathedral, which had a lot of rot and fungus elements, but I’m unsure what cautions the others might offer.

Read full topic
